medical_history.chief_complaint: Diffuse abdominal pain most prominent in the right upper quadrant (RUQ), severe.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Pain abruptly began on an unspecified day and has been severe. Accompanied by nausea, intermittent nausea, and inability to take oral intake. Patient has had low-grade fever (99Â°F) but no chills.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, Hyperlipidemia, Heavy chronic smoking history, Type II Diabetes, Chronic left great toenail fungus with removal, history of toe amputation due to necrosis and complications including DVT treated with Warfarin, appendectomy, and tonsillectomy.
medical_history.family_history: One sister with diabetes, one brother with diabetes.
